Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer's unbeaten 74 off 44 balls trumped Pathum Nissanka's 75 off 53
Ravindra Jadeja's 45 not out off 18 outshone Dasun Shanaka's 47 not out off 19
India chased down Sri Lanka's 183 for 5 with seven wickets and 17 balls to spare
Nissanka hit 11 fours during his stay, while Shanaka preferred the aerial route and struck two fours and five sixes
Shreyas Iyer hit six fours and four sixes in his unbeaten 74
Sanju Samson began scratchily too, but he took 23 off the 13th over, bowled by Lahiru Kumara
Jadeja did the bulk of the scoring from there on, and handed India a comfortable win in the end
Pre-Game Insights: India's batters making the most of their chances
India won by 7 wickets (with 17 balls remaining)
Nissanka hit 11 fours during his stay, while Shanaka preferred the aerial route and struck two fours and five sixes
Post-Match Reflections: Shreyas Iyer's unbeaten 74 off 44 balls trumped Pathum Nissanka's 75 off 53
Ravindra Jadeja's 45 not out off 18 outshone Dasun Shanaka's 47 not out off 19
India chased down Sri Lanka's 183 for 5 with seven wickets and 17 balls to spare in the second T20I in Dharamsala
The win, India's 11th on the trot in T20Is, gave the hosts an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's sedate start with only 15 runs and hit just one boundary in the first four overs
Pathum Nissanka and Dasun Shanaka ransacked 72 off the last four overs
Nissanka reached his fifty off 43 balls with a boundary off Chahal
Dushmantha Chameera dismissed Rohit Sharma for the fifth time in T20Is
Shreyas broke the shackles by launching Praveen Jayawickrama for back-to-back sixes
Samson hit three sixes and a four in Kumara's third over
